CatDescriptText: Lewis McClaine, art student, Fifth Ward and William (Bill) Hatch, art student, Centre YMCA, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 14, 1961, pg. B1 with question: "At what age should young folks be allowed to have unchaperoned parties?" Lewis McClaine's answer reads: "It depends on the individual child, whether or not he is mature.  Generally speaking, I would say around the age of 16."  William (Bill) Hatch's answer reads: "I think generally that girls should be permitted to do so around 16 or 17 years of age, while it seems to take longer for boys to mature, so their age would be around 18...."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Lewis McClaine wearing striped shirt and wool coat with collar up, standing in front of building; Portrait of William (Bill) Hatch wearing plaid hat, moustache, and zippered jacket, standing in front of light colored building
